Quotes: Real difficulties can be overcome, it is only the imaginary ones that are unconquerable…
Author: Theodore N. Vail

Quotes: Worrying is like paying a debt you don't owe…
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: He who hasn't tasted bitter things hasn't earned sweet things…
Author: Gottfried Wilhelm Leibniz

Quotes: Time flies over us, but leaves its shadow behind…
Author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

Quotes: No amount of evidence will ever persuade an idiot…
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: The door of the human heart, can only be opened from the inside…
Author: William Holman Hunt

Quotes: I'll go anywhere as long as it's forward…
Author: David Livingstone

Quotes: Every drop of rain hits its appointed target…
Author: John Newton

Quotes: If you light a lantern for another, it will also brighten your own way…
Author: Nichiren

Quotes: The more certain our knowledge the less we know…
Author: Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel

Quotes: The money you have gives you freedom;the money you pursue enslaves you…
Author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

Quotes: The large majority of people are asleep and do not wish to wake up…
Author: Vincent van Gogh

Quotes: Hatred does not cease by hatred, but only by love…
Author: Gautama The Lord Buddha

Quotes: God gave us mouths that close and ears that don't.. that should tell us something…
Author: Eugene O'Neill

Quotes: What a terrible era in which idiots govern the blind…
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: Who loves a lot, forgives a lot…
Author: Amado Nervo

Quotes: Happiness is a butterfly, which when pursued, is always just beyond your grasp, but which, if you will sit down quietly, may alight upon you…
Author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

Quotes: Sight is a faculty;seeing is an art…
Author: George Perkins Marsh

Quotes: In every walk with nature one receives far more than he seeks…
Author: John Muir

Quotes: Be the sun and all will see you…
Author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

Quotes: The past attracts me, the present frightens me, because the future is death…
Author: Guy de Maupassant

Quotes: Doing little things well is a step toward doing big things better…
Author: Vincent van Gogh

Quotes: It is after you have lost your teeth that you can afford to buy steaks…
Author: Pierre Auguste Renoir

Quotes: The fallen angel becomes a malignant devil…
Author: Mary Shelley

Quotes: Every moment is a fresh beginning…
Author: T.S. Eliot

Quotes: The real voyage of discovery consists not in seeking new landscapes, but in having new eyes…
Author: Marcel Proust

Quotes: If one thinks that one is happy, that is enough to be happy…
Author: Madame de La Fayette

Quotes: Why do you complain of your fate when you could so easily change it?…
Author: Marquis de Sade

Quotes: The beginning is always today…
Author: Mary Wollstonecraft

Quotes: Where words are restrained, the eyes often talk a great deal…
Author: Samuel Richardson

Quotes: Sleep in peace, and wake in joy…
Author: Walter Scott

Quotes: The more we study, the more we discover our ignorance…
Author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

Quotes: Always laugh when you can. It is cheap medicine…
Author: Lord Byron

Quotes: The only time you run out of chances is when you stop taking them…
Author: Alexander Pope

Quotes: If you want to make enemies, try to change something…
Author: Woodrow Wilson

Quotes: As soon as you trust yourself, you will know how to live…
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quotes: Nothing is impossible to a willing heart…
Author: John Heywood

Quotes: The only sure way to avoid making mistakes is to have no new ideas…
Author: Albert Einstein

Quotes: The real voyage of discovery consists not in seeking new landscapes, but in having new eyes…
Author: Marcel Proust

Quotes: A man would do nothing if he waited until he could do it so well that no one could find fault…
Author: John Henry Newman

Quotes: My great concern is not whether you have failed, but whether you are content with your failure…
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quotes: Earth provides enough to satisfy every man's needs, but not every man's greed…
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quotes: You may not get everything you dream about, but you will never get anything you don't dream about…
Author: William James

Quotes: When men are most sure and arrogant, they are commonly the most mistaken…
Author: David Hume

Quotes: When two forces unite, their efficiency double…
Author: Isaac Newton

Quotes: He who fights, can lose. He who doesn't fight, has already lost…
Author: Bertolt Brecht

Quotes: The future comes slowly, the present flies and the past stands still forever…
Author: Friedrich Schiller

Quotes: The tree that would grow to heaven must send its roots to hell…
Author: Frederick Nietzsche

Quotes: Confidence is the present tense of hope…
Author: Soren Kierkegaard

Quotes: When the sufferers learn to think, then the thinkers will learn to suffer…
Author: Karl Marx

Quotes: The freedom of all is essential to my freedom…
Author: Mikhail Bakunin

Quotes: When deeds speak, words are nothing…
Author: Pierre-Joseph Proudhon

Quotes: If we all think alike, no one is thinking…
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quotes: The most difficult thing in life is to know yourself…
Author: Thales

Quotes: If horses had Gods, they would look like horses…
Author: Xenophanes

Quotes: By silence, I hear other men's imperfections and conceal my own…
Author: Zeno of Elea

Quotes: No price is too high to pay for the privilege of owning yourself…
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: Attack the evil that is within yourself, rather than attacking the evil that is in others…
Author: Confucius

Quotes: The person attempting to travel two roads at once will get nowhere…
Author: Xunzi

Quotes: What is a holy person?. The one who is aware of others' suffering…
Author: Kabir

Quotes: The art of knowing is knowing what to ignore…
Author: Rumi

Quotes: Those who cry the loudest are not always the ones who are hurt the most…
Author: Aesop

Quotes: Suspicion is the cancer of friendship…
Author: Petrarch

Quotes: Love wants everything without condition, love has no law…
Author: Pierre de Ronsard

Quotes: If you wish to avoid seeing a fool you must first break your mirror…
Author: Francois Rabelais

Quotes: Pride and excess bring disaster for man…
Author: Xunzi

Quotes: Maybe you are searching among the branches, for what only appears in the roots…
Author: Rumi

Quotes: It is by loving and not by being loved that one can come nearest to the soul of another…
Author: George MacDonald

Quotes: No problem can be solved from the same level of consciousness that created it…
Author: Albert Einstein

Quotes: Have a heart that never hardens, and a temper that never tires, and a touch that never hurts…
Author: Charles Dickens

Quotes: There are some things you learn best in calm, and some in storm…
Author: Willa Cather

Quotes: He who has health, has hope;and he who has hope, has everything…
Author: Thomas Carlyle

Quotes: Blossom by blossom the spring begins…
Author: Algernon Charles Swinburne

Quotes: I'm not afraid of failure;I'm afraid of succeeding at things that don't matter…
Author: William Carey

Quotes: One moment can change a day, one day can change a life and one life can change the world…
Author: Gautama The Lord Buddha

Quotes: The idea does not belong to the soul;it is the soul that belongs to the idea…
Author: Charles Sanders Peirce

Quotes: If you want the present to be different from the past, study the past…
Author: Baruch Spinoza

Quotes: Look at life with the eyes of a child…
Author: Kathe Kollwitz

Quotes: People love to be nice, but you must give them the chance…
Author: Pierre-Auguste Renoir

Quotes: Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself…
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: The worst that a man can do to himself is to do injustice to others…
Author: Henrik Ibsen

Quotes: Children find everything in nothing, men find nothing in everything…
Author: Giacomo Leopardi

Quotes: A wise man hears one word and understands two…
Author: Edgar Allan Poe

Quotes: The sight of a coward's blood can never make a warrior tremble…
Author: James F. Cooper

Quotes: Life isn't easy, but dreams keep you alive…
Author: John Muir

Quotes: No amount of evidence will ever persuade an idiot…
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: If you shut up truth, and bury it underground, it will but grow…
Author: Emile Zola

Quotes: The best way to make your dreams come true is to wake up…
Author: Paul Valery

Quotes: To give pleasure to a single heart by a single act is better than a thousand heads bowing in prayer…
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quotes: It is very unfair to judge of any body's conduct, without an intimate knowledge of their situation…
Author: Jane Austen

Quotes: Love betters what is best…
Author: William Wordsworth

Quotes: Fall if you will, but rise you must…
Author: James Joyce

Quotes: Only great minds can afford a simple style…
Author: Stendhal

Quotes: Revenge is a dish best served cold…
Author: Pierre Choderlos de Laclos

Quotes: Happiest are the people who give most happiness to others…
Author: Denis Diderot

Quotes: Forgiveness is the economy of the heart.. forgiveness saves the expense of anger, the cost of hatred, the waste of spirits…
Author: Hannah More

Quotes: He who waits to do a great deal of good at once, will never do anything…
Author: Samuel Johnson

Quotes: What comes from the heart goes to the heart…
Author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

Quotes: To stay youthful, stay useful…
Author: John Keats

Quotes: Every cloud has a silver lining…
Author: John Milton
